2.caption: 1996 Major League Baseball All-Star Game
2.description: The 1996 Major League Baseball All-Star Game was the 67th playing of the midsummer classic between the all-stars of the American League (AL) and National League (NL), the two leagues comprising Major League Baseball. The game was held on July 9, 1996, at Veterans Stadium in Philadelphia, the home of the Philadelphia Phillies of the National League. This marked the 15th and final all star game appearance of Ozzie Smith, who retired after the 1996 season. Smith entered the game in the top of the sixth inning. His first at-bat was greeted by chants of "Oz-zie, Oz-zie" from the Philadelphia crowd. Iron Man Cal Ripken, Jr., who was in the midst of his record-breaking run of consecutive games played, broke his nose during the pre-game AL team picture. However, he was ready to go at game time and started at SS.
2.inspected:Ceremonial first pitch: Mike Schmidt, Richie Ashburn, Jim Bunning, Steve Carlton and Robin Roberts
2.inspected:TV announcers: Bob Costas, Joe Morgan and Bob Uecker (NBC)Gary Thorne and Ken Singleton (MLB International)
